page.title: 09RURAL INDUSTRY IN WHALTON
page.content: {The Village Blacksmith and Farrier} is Ernie McDougall who has worked in the forge at the east end of the Manor House since 1972. He works mainly as a travelling farrier but also does beautiful wrought iron work, including restoration work for the National Trust, and agricultural repairs. {Livestock Haulier}Fred Law and his son Peter run an agricultural and general haulage business. They have 3 wagons and employ 1 man. {Fencer and Hedge_layer}Gordon Hodgson and his son Stephen run a fencing business. They also undertake hedge laying and make jumps for the local hunt. {Race Horse Trainer,}Lady Caroline Renwick keeps a total of 10 horses including 4 race horses under training and 2 brood mares. She employs 1 full_ time and 1 part-time groom.
